para.dtcname: No. 1 Fuel Injector Driver Circuit Performance
No. 2 Fuel Injector Driver Circuit Performance

content5.ptxt: The injector driver (EDU) delivers drive signals to fuel injectors using the DC/DC converter, which provides a high-voltage and quick-charging system.

Soon after the injector driver (EDU) receives a fuel injection command (#1 to #8) signal from the ECM, the injector driver (EDU) responds to the command with an injector injection confirmation (INJF, INF2) signal when the current is applied to the fuel injector.

item.ptxt: Open or short in injector driver (EDU) circuit

The ECM compares injection command (#1 to #8) signals and injection confirmation (INJF, INF2) signals for each cylinder. If the ECM determines that a cylinder has a malfunction, DTC P0201, P0202, P0203, P0204, P0205, P0206, P0207 or P0208 will be stored.

The ECM continuously monitors both injection command (#1 to #8) signals and injection confirmation (INJF, INF2) signals. These DTCs will be stored if the ECM determines that the number of #1 to #8 signals and INJF, INF2 signals are inconsistent.

The injector assemblies are grounded over a Field Effect Transistor (FET) and a serial resistor. This resistor creates a voltage drop, which is monitored by the injector driver (EDU) (injector drive circuit) in relation to the current drawn by the fuel injector. When the fuel injector current becomes too high, the voltage drops over the resistor exceeds a specified level and no INJF or INF2 signal for that cylinder is sent to the ECM.

After the engine is started, when there is no injection confirmation (INJF, INF2) signal from the injector driver (EDU) to the ECM even though the ECM sends injection command (#1 to #8) signals to the injector driver (EDU), DTC P062D or P062E is stored.
If either of these DTCs is stored, the ECM enters fail-safe mode and limits engine power or stops the engine. The fail-safe mode continues until the ignition switch is turned off.

atten2.ptxt: Make sure to perform work on high voltage circuits with the ignition switch off.

item.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration (See page ).

atten4.ptxt: Read freeze frame data using the GTS. Freeze frame data records the engine condition when malfunctions are detected. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ENGINE CRANKING CONDITION AND DTC OUTPUT

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Read the DTCs.
Check the engine cranking condition.

entry.ptxt: Engine starts, but idling is rough (P062D or P062E is output)*1
Engine starts, but idling is rough*2
Engine does not start (P062D and P062E are output)*3

item.ptxt: *1: Only one of either DTC P062D or P062E is output and one of the injector drivers (EDU) has stopped.
*2: DTC P0201, P0202, P0203, P0204, P0205, P0206, P0207, P0208, P062D and P062E are stored at this time.
*3: When the engine cannot be started due to a malfunction in the No. 1 and No. 2 injector driver (EDU), DTCs are not stored again if they are cleared.
Also, the value for "Common Rail Pressure" is higher than the value for "Target Common Rail Pressure"

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the No. 1 and No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connectors.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Check the waveform of the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector using an oscilloscope.
Turn the ignition switch off.

atten4.ptxt: Powering of the EDU relay may be prohibited by the fail-safe function. Therefore, turn the ignition switch off to disable the fail-safe function before performing this inspection.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Measure the voltage according to the value(s) in the table below.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (INJECTOR DRIVER (EDU) - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Reconnect the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.
Replace the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine and idle it for 5 seconds or more.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Confirm that the DTC is not output again.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (INJECTOR DRIVER (EDU) - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Reconnect the injector driver (EDU) connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.
Replace the ECM.
Click here
Go to injector circuit.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off for 30 seconds.
Start the engine and idle it for 30 seconds.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Check the DTCs output on the GTS.

item.ptxt: The cylinder with the malfunctioning fuel injector can be determined based on the output DTCs.
If DTC P0201 is output, check the No. 1 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0202 is output, check the No. 2 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0203 is output, check the No. 3 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0204 is output, check the No. 4 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0205 is output, check the No. 5 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0206 is output, check the No. 6 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0207 is output, check the No. 7 fuel injector circuit.
If DTC P0208 is output, check the No. 8 fuel injector circuit.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the fuel injector connectors for all cylinders.

atten3.ptxt: If only the injector assembly connector of the malfunctioning cylinder is disconnected, the engine will start and there will be rough idling. Therefore, disconnect all fuel injector connectors before inspecting the waveform.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Check the waveform of the fuel injector connectors using an oscilloscope.

entry.ptxt: Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more
Voltage increases by 50 V or more

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the cylinder relevant to the DTC.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the fuel injector connectors.
Disconnect the No. 1 or No. 2 injector driver (EDU) connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
